trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus"></xref> Web server control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control renders a button that automatically checks the authentication status of the user and displays the appropriate login or logout option.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
The LoginStatusDesigner class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> to generate the design-time markup, since the user authentication status is not available at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> at design time.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Gets the designer action list collection for this designer.

The ActionLists property creates a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner> class, adds it to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> that is obtained from the ActionLists base property, and then returns the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> collection.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LogoutText%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LoginText%2A> property (depending on whether the user is logged in), is `null`, an empty string (""), or a single space (" "), the GetDesignTimeHtml method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LogoutText%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LoginText%2A> property, as appropriate, to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property, enclosed in brackets ("[ ]").

Then, regardless of the setting of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LoginText%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LogoutText%2A>, the GetDesignTimeHtml method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> base method to generate the markup for the design-time rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control.
A string containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus"></xref> at design time.
Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.
The visual designer calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control.
The Initialize and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus"></xref>, which implements an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

Because the UsePreviewControl property is always `true`, the designer <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property returns a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control to generate the design-time markup.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property creates the copy by persisting the actual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control, then parsing the persisted control string.
The copied control does not affect any persistence for the actual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus>.

If the UsePreviewControl property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control will persist to the page markup source.
Always <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
